## Purchases.configure() method

Configures the Purchases SDK. This should be called as soon as your app has a unique user id for your user. You should only call this once, and keep the returned instance around for use throughout your application.

**Signature:**

```typescript
static configure(apiKey: string, appUserId: string): Purchases;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  apiKey | string | RevenueCat API Key. Can be obtained from the RevenueCat dashboard. |
|  appUserId | string | Your unique id for identifying the user. |

**Returns:**

[Purchases](./purchases-js.purchases.md)
